section.section: The qualified expert shall examine the child and prepare a report stating whether, in the expert's opinion, the child is incompetent to proceed.
In conducting the examination, the qualified expert shall review all available medical, educational, and court records concerning the child and the child's case.

If the qualified expert believes that the child is incompetent to proceed, the report shall describe the treatment that the qualified expert believes is necessary for the child to attain competency to proceed, and, in a separate report, shall state whether the child poses a danger to the child or to the person or property of others.

All reports required under this section shall be filed with the court and served on the child's counsel, the State's Attorney, and the Department of Juvenile Services within 45 days after the court orders the examination.
On good cause shown, the court may extend the time period specified in paragraph (1) of this subsection for an additional 15 days.
Failure to file a complete report within the time periods specified in this subsection may not be, in and of itself, grounds for dismissal of the petition alleging delinquency.

text.section: Counsel for the child may be present at an examination under this section.
